snippet: Husain Haqqani, the former Pakistani ambassador to the United States, is tangled in a battle over a controversial memo that he says has put his life in jeopardy.
abstract: Memo from Pakistan; Husain Haqqani, former Pakistani ambassador to the United States, has spent the past five weeks sequestered in the premier’s residence, tangled in a legal battle over a controversial memo that allegedly solicited help in stopping a possible coup by the humiliated Pakistani military.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Eric Schmitt from Islamabad and Washington.

lead_paragraph: Husain Haqqani, the former Pakistani ambassador to the United States, is tangled in a battle over a controversial memo that he says has put his life in jeopardy.

headline.seo: Husain Haqqani Confined in Pakistan Amid Legal Battle
headline.main: A Diplomat in a Gilded Cage, Feeling Trapped and Not Entirely Safe
headline.print_headline: A Diplomat in a Gilded Cage, Feeling Trapped and Not Entirely Safe
